documentation.text:
@dev Emitted when system account is added.
 @param account is a new system account.

@dev Emitted when system account is removed.
 @param account is the old system account.
@dev Modifier which prevents non-system accounts from calling protected functions.

@dev Modifier which prevents non-system accounts from being passed to the guard.
 @param account The account to check.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Roles.Role storage pointer,address) view returns (bool)

documentation.text:
@dev Assigns the system role to an account.
 @notice This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

@dev Removes the system role from an account.
 @notice This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

@dev Emitted when system account is added.
 @param account is a new system account.

@dev Emitted when system account is removed.
 @param account is the old system account.
@dev Modifier which prevents non-system accounts from calling protected functions.

@dev Modifier which prevents non-system accounts from being passed to the guard.
 @param account The account to check.

documentation.text:
@dev Assigns the system role to an account.
 @notice This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

@dev Removes the system role from an account.
 @notice This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

devdoc.details: SystemRole accounts have been approved to perform operational actions (e.g. mint and burn).

SystemAccountAdded(address).details: Emitted when system account is added.

SystemAccountRemoved(address).details: Emitted when system account is removed.

addSystemAccount(address).details: Assigns the system role to an account.

isSystemAccount(address).details: Checks whether an address is a system account.

removeSystemAccount(address).details: Removes the system role from an account.

devdoc.title: SystemRole

addSystemAccount(address).notice: This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

removeSystemAccount(address).notice: This method is unprotected and should be authorized in the child contract.

userdoc.notice: addSystemAccount and removeSystemAccount are unprotected by default, i.e. anyone can call them.Contracts inheriting SystemRole *should* authorize the caller by overriding them.The contract is an abstract contract.
